org.sakaiproject.tool.section.jsf.backingbean

Class InitializableBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sakaiproject.tool.section.jsf.backingbean.InitializableBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PhaseAware
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CourseDependentBean

    public abstract class InitializableBean
extends Object
implements PhaseAware
    Base class for JSF backing beans wishing to be initialized on page load.
    Author:
    Josh Holtzman

    • Constructor Detail

      • InitializableBean

        public InitializableBean()

    • Method Detail

      • init

        protected void init()
        JSF doesn't provide a way to configure an initialization method which will be called after the contructor and all framework setters. By convention, our backing beans use this method. It's triggered either by a Faces configuration file setting "configured" to true, or by a JSF component directly calling "startRenderResponse". For greater subclassing flexibility, the init method is not declared to be abstract.

      • endProcessValidators

        public void endProcessValidators()
        Remember if JSF entered the Validations phase. If so, and if we never reach the Update Model Values phase, then validation failed. That may be of interest to the backing bean. For example, the backing bean may choose not to requery and reload data on a validation error.
        Specified by:
        endProcessValidators in interface PhaseAware

      • endProcessUpdates

        public void endProcessUpdates()
        Description copied from interface: PhaseAware
        Called after the component has finished the Update Model Values phase.
        Specified by:
        endProcessUpdates in interface PhaseAware

      • startRenderResponse

        public void startRenderResponse()
        Call init() at the beginning of every request rendering. (This should also work to refresh session-scoped beans, but it's only been tested with request scope.)
        Specified by:
        startRenderResponse in interface PhaseAware

        public boolean isNotValidated()

      • setNotValidated

        Signals that configuration is finished.
